title: Google\Cloud\Compute\V1\Reservation
name: Reservation
description:
Represents a reservation resource. A reservation ensures that capacity is held in a specific zone even if the reserved VMs are not running. For more information, read Reserving zonal resources. (== resource_for {$api_version}.reservations ==)

Generated from protobuf message google.cloud.compute.v1.Reservation

Extends Google\Protobuf\Internal\Message

methods.name: __construct
methods.description: Constructor.

params.name: data
params.description: Optional. Data for populating the Message object.

params.name: data.commitment
params.description: [Output Only] Full or partial URL to a parent commitment. This field displays for reservations that are tied to a commitment.

params.name: data.creation_timestamp
params.description: [Output Only] Creation timestamp in RFC3339 text format.

params.name: data.description
params.description: An optional description of this resource. Provide this property when you create the resource.

params.name: data.id
params.description: [Output Only] The unique identifier for the resource. This identifier is defined by the server.

params.name: data.kind
params.description: [Output Only] Type of the resource. Always compute#reservations for reservations.

params.name: data.name
params.description: The name of the resource, provided by the client when initially creating the resource. The resource name must be 1-63 characters long, and comply with RFC1035. Specifically, the name must be 1-63 characters long and match the regular expression [a-z]([-a-z0-9]*[a-z0-9])? which means the first character must be a lowercase letter, and all following characters must be a dash, lowercase letter, or digit, except the last character, which cannot be a dash.

params.name: data.self_link
params.description: [Output Only] Server-defined fully-qualified URL for this resource.

params.name: data.specific_reservation
params.description: Reservation for instances with specific machine shapes.

params.name: data.specific_reservation_required
params.description: Indicates whether the reservation can be consumed by VMs with affinity for "any" reservation. If the field is set, then only VMs that target the reservation by name can consume from this reservation.

params.name: data.status
params.description: [Output Only] The status of the reservation.

params.name: data.zone
params.description: Zone in which the reservation resides. A zone must be provided if the reservation is created within a commitment.

methods.name: getSpecificReservationRequired
methods.description:
